intro: Phacelia marcescens, commonly known as the persistent phacelia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy stems and clusters of blue to purple flowers. The plant is typically found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a fuzzy texture, while its flowers bloom in late spring to early summer. Phacelia marcescens is known for its ability to thrive in arid conditions and is sometimes used in ecological restoration projects.
